docs.snippet: Kim Yu-na of South Korea can become only the third woman to win consecutive Olympic gold medals in figure skating; Yulia Lipnitskaya of Russia can be youngest champion in 16 years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kim Yu-na of South Korea can become only the third woman to win consecutive Olympic gold medals in figure skating; Yulia Lipnitskaya of Russia can be youngest champion in 16 years.
docs.abstract: Kim Yu-na of South Korea can become only the third woman to win consecutive Olympic gold medals in figure skating at Sochi; 15-year-old Yulia Lipnitskaya of Russia can be youngest champion in 16 years.

headline.seo: Kim Yu-na Seeks Consecutive Figure Skating Golds
headline.main: A Battle for Gold and Posterity
headline.print_headline: A Battle for Gold and Posterity

docs.snippet: The number of people who must avoid gluten for health reasons is relatively small, but other consumers have joined them to create a lucrative market the food industry covets....
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people who must avoid gluten for health reasons is relatively small, but other consumers have joined them to create a lucrative market the food industry covets.
docs.abstract: Number of people who must avoid gluten for health reasons is relatively small, but other consumers have joined them to create a lucrative market the food industry covets; Nielsen reports 11 percent of households in 2012 purchased gluten-free food, up from 5 percent in 2010; product sales for 2012 are projected at $10.5 billion, with more than $15 billion in 2016.
